title: Enhancing Organizational Development Competencies: Scientific Job Learning Design Based on Higher-Order Thinking Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for Corporate Management/HR Professionals

learning_goals: Apply Anderson & Krathwohl’s four knowledge dimensions (factual, conceptual, procedural, metacognitive) to scientific problem-solving.

In scientific problem situations in business/HR (e.g., employee turnover analysis, organizational efficiency diagnosis), learners apply critical thinking (5 Whys technique) and creativity (brainstorming, SCAMPER technique) to propose three or more solutions, achieving over 70 points based on peer evaluation and instructor feedback criteria (Creativity 30%, Feasibility 30%, Logicality 40%).

Using online collaboration tools (Slack, Trello, Google Workspace), learners participate in a four-week team-based science project (topic: sustainable energy solutions), achieve three weekly milestones, and submit a final project report meeting at least four of five evaluation criteria.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
